p: 21. λόγος as judgment can be either true or false. Unlike νοεῖν, λόγος qua showing something as something has a synthesis structure, which allows for a covering-up. Opposed to that is a “true judgment” [ἀλήϑεια-3], which itself has multiple foundation</>s.<>n</> Realism and idealism both miss the Greek sense of ἀλήϑεια, which alone is the source of any “theory of ideas” as philosophical knowledge.
